summary.p: Second volume of a 2-volume manuscript belonging to Édouard-Simon Ariel's (1818-1854) collection. It contains a total of 564 verb roots that are alphabetically organized into seven different booklets, each starting with an intertitle-page, indicating to their initial letter. Letters run from ந to வ.
The first volume is BnF Indien 160.
Description by Cristina MURU based on the Gallica images.
Original manuscript examined by Emmanuel FRANCIS, March 2025.

support.p: Different size and colours. As in manuscript BnF Indien 194 from the same author, different types of paper are found: (a) brownish and thick paper; (b) a light yellowish colour; (c) a darker yellowish colour paper. Two other types of paper are also found: (d) a light blue colour and (e) ruled paper. Examples of these latter types of paper can be found at ff. 123, 197, 202, 205, 224, 250, 279, 282, 289, 299, etc. As the size of the paper varies, one finds not only pages which are smaller, but also smaller paper sheets, with kinds of notes, sometimes written on the light blue colour paper, pasted on the main page as if they were errata corrige.

extent.measure: 1 + 564 + 1 (u1 + U1 + u2) ― 1 front guard leaf + 564 + 1 back guard leaf.

foliation.p: Foliation starts with the number 1 and it is regularly found on the upper right side of the recto. From f306 onwards, 2 or 3 folios (each with their own foliation) have often been glued together so as to appear as a single folio. See f307-309, f310-311, etc. In few instances there is another (erased or not) number next to the one representing the main foliation. For instance, f80 also bears the foliation 347.

collation.desc: the front cover. Shelfmark on recto.
1 folio = front guard leaf. No foliation. 220 x 350 mm. Shelfmark on f[1]r. Verso blank. Element of binding.

564 folios = Radicaux tamils 2. Various sizes but no exceding 220 x 350 mm. Smaller folios have been glued together probably when rebinding the volume. The verso are left blank unless it is a reused folio (what was written earlier is deleted on the new verso) or unless the description of the Tamil verb root on the recto continues on the verso (see e.g. ff. 3, 10, 15, 18, 23, 52, 55, 63, 65, 66, 69, etc.).
1 folio = back guard leaf. 220 x 350 mm. No foliation. Element of binding.

handNote.desc: The handwriting by Edouard Ariel is difficult to read. For some verb roots, a Sanskrit corresponding form written in Devanagari script is provided. Examples are found at ff. 53r, 54r, 78r, 84r, 89r, 130r, 236r, 253r.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 161 (front cover, verso).

There are two different stamps found at the beginning and at the end of each booklet. The first one is a red circle containing an eagle and the writing BIBLIOTHEQUE IMPERIALE MSS.. This is the stamp in use from 1852 to 1870 (cf. stamp n. 36 in Josserand and Bruno 1960: 282). The second one is a red oval containing the writing DON n°. Examples of the combination of these two stamps can be found at ff. 137r, 226r, 367r. The number of donation is not specified, however the handwriting, as well as the paper used allow to identify it as a manuscript belonging to Ariel whose collection was transferred from the Société Asiatique to the BnF in 1866 (Berthier 2000: 61). In some other cases only the first stamp is found like at ff. 224v, 365v.
Old shelfmark in red pencil: Tamoul 159 (f[1]r).

binding.p: Hard paper covers, marbled on the outside.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Being a manuscrip by Ariel, the date of composition is based on his period of stay in Pondicherry where he arrived in 1844 as a French Marine Officer after having studied with Eugène Burnof (1801-1852) in Paris (see James 2000: 198-199).

acquisition.p: It entered the Bibliothèque Nationale with Ariel's collection in 1866 (see Berthier 2000: 61).
